thread.title: George Galloway in bizarre rant against 'Blair babe' Ben Bradshaw

author: Rom Preston-Ellis
title: George Galloway in bizarre rant against 'Blair babe' Ben Bradshaw
text:
George Galloway in bizarre rant against 'Blair babe' Ben Bradshaw Mr Galloway described the Exeter MP as a 'Duracell bunny' with 'hair flopping like a rabbit's ears' Share George Galloway (left) has attacked Ben Bradshaw in an online column Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
Controversial politician and broadcaster George Galloway has hit out at Exeter MP Ben Bradshaw in a bizarre blog on a right-wing news website. 
Writing for Westmonster - dubbed the British version of Breitbart - the former MP described Mr Bradshaw as a 'Duracell bunny' with 'hair flopping like a rabbit's ears'. 
In the article the politician famously remembered for his cat role play on Celebrity Big Brother criticises the Exeter MP for supporting Tony Blair's wars in Yugoslavia and Iraq - and for recently speaking in Parliament about the Russian government's alleged interference in the EU referendum. 
"This week at PMQs Bradders was bob bob bobbing in the House again," wrote Mr Galloway. Read More 'Dangerous' Newton Abbot road speed limit will be changed when funding comes available 
"His latest cause (well it has all been the same seamless cause really) is that Russia fixed Brexit. That’s right, the working class from Sunderland to South Wales had all got the memo from Putin and duly obliged. And if Russia fixed it, she must have some fixers right?" 
A strong opponent of the UK's decision to leave the EU, Mr Bradshaw asked Theresa May at Prime Minister's Questions on Wednesday: "With today's news that the Electoral Commission is investigating Arron Banks, the main financial backer of Brexit, along with the significant British connections being uncovered by the American Justice Department's special counsel Robert Mueller, investigating Russian interference in the US presidential election, will you assure me that the UK Government and all its agencies are co-operating fully with the Mueller investigation or will do so if asked?" 
Arron Banks, the biggest financial backer of the campaign to leave the EU, launched Westmonster following the Brexit vote. The website says it aims to 'funnel the different people who backed Brexit into one place'. Read More Retail park congestion prompts bus operator to make changes to its services 
The Electoral Commission announced this week that it was looking into whether Mr Banks was the 'true source' of three loans worth £6m on non-commercial terms to the Leave.EU campaign he also chairs. 
In the article, Mr Galloway also referred to an incident in Parliament in 2002 where Mr Bradshaw described him as 'mouthpiece' to Saddam Hussein's regime. 
Mr Galloway also questioned the Exeter MP's decision to rebel against a Labour-led motion to withdraw support for the Saudi-led campaign in Yemen, claiming he was the 'organiser of the greatest Blairite rebellion against Jeremy Corbyn'. 
An outspoken critic of the Mr Corbyn following his election as Labour leader in 2015, Mr Bradshaw has since conceded that he has changed his mind about him, saying that he is 'growing' into his role at the head of the party. Like us on Facebook
